item.title: EP 736 - Close Encounters Of The Turned On Kind!
item.itunes:title: Close Encounters Of The Turned On Kind!
item.description:
Today we go to college only to get haunted by a bloody ghost, and then we meet four hot space babes and things go terribly wrong!

 

Patreon 

https://www.patreon.com/user?u=18482113

 

MERCH STORE!!!

https://tinyurl.com/y8zam4o2

 

Help Promote Dead Rabbit!

Dual Flyer

https://i.imgur.com/OhuoI2v.jpg

"As Above" Flyer

https://i.imgur.com/yobMtUp.jpg

“Alien Flyer” By TVP VT U

https://imgur.com/gallery/aPN1Fnw

 

Links:

Dead Rabbit Recommends: SCP-1733

http://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-1733

St. Charles Hall, Carroll College, Helena

https://billingsgazette.com/news/state-and-regional/montana/13-of-montanas-most-haunted-places/collection_8ed26ee9-e9ea-5128-b79c-ae6bb6cf3638.html#8

Helena Montana Carroll College

http://hauntedhouses.com/montana/carroll-college/

IS THERE ANYBODY OUT THERE?

https://helenair.com/lifestyles/is-there-anybody-out-there/article_8a3e1418-07eb-11df-adf7-001cc4c03286.html

Montana's Carroll College Bathroom Ghost

http://theresashauntedhistoryofthetri-state.blogspot.com/2014/02/montanas-carroll-college-bathroom-ghost.html

Carroll College

https://www.scaryforkids.com/carroll-college/

St. Charles Hall - Carroll College

https://www.hauntedplaces.org/item/st-charles-hall-carroll-college/

1982: Simferopol, Crimea, Ukraine Abduction (Needlepoint Sex story)

http://www.thinkaboutitdocs.com/1982-simferopol-crimea-ukraine-abduction/

Listen to the daily podcast anywhere you listen to podcasts!

------------------------------------------------

Logo Art By Ash Black

Opening Song: "Atlantis Attacks"

Closing Song: "Bella Royale"

Music By Simple

Rabbitron 3000 created by Eerbud

Thanks to Chris K, Founder Of The Golden Rabbit Brigade

Dead Rabbit Archivist Some Weirdo On Twitter AKA Jack

YouTube Champ Stewart Meatball

The Haunted Mic Arm provided by Chyme Chili

Jason Carpenter

Paranormal, Conspiracy, and True Crime news as it happens! Jason Carpenter breaks the stories they'll be talking about tomorrow, assuming the world doesn't end today.
